CatDescriptText: Mrs. M.J. Fleming, housewife, clerk, education student, 7239 Hermitage Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "I would say that it is a combination of all.  We have to have the three in life, that is- leadership in politics, labor and the church.  I don't know which is followed the most.  Quite a lot of people say the church."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. M.J. Fleming wearing dark lace gloves, eyeglasses, and hat, holding handbag and Redbook and Post magazines, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Thrift Drugs and Kappels stores in background, Downtown
